intro: Nephrodium procerum, commonly known as the slender kidney fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, slender fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant has a creeping rhizome that produces both sterile and fertile fronds. The fertile fronds bear sori that are clustered along the margins of the leaves. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices.
